intro: Choristegeres centiflorus, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and coastal climates. It produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite head, giving it a daisy-like appearance. Choristegeres centiflorus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance.
